dialog.text: Hi, how are you doing? The seeker  is doing well. The supporter could say the seeker has somebullying worries.
Oh, hi. I'm doing good. How about you?

Yeah, I'm feeling a little bit upset about my friend. The seeker  feels upset about friend because the supporter could tell she is related to someone who is feeling upset. The supporter could try to talk about the feeling and how it is related to the seeker's friend.
I'm so sorry to hear that. Did anything happen?

Yeah, we used to hang out together quite often, but he's got a new girlfriend recently. His girlfriend is very unpleasant to everyone and doesn't allow him to spend a lot of time with us. That's bothering me. The seeker  is feeling upset about the other person because the supporter should be. The supporter could try to talk to the seeker about the feeling.
I can understand how you feel. It's very annoying when people don't allow their partners to have friends.
beam_texts: I can understand how you feel. It's very annoying when people don't allow their partners to have friends.

dialog.text: Yeah, we used to hang out all the time. She's never been a problem before. I don't know what happened. The seeker  feels upset because he friend used to be very friendly and caring. I think it might be worth talking to her again. It's possible that she didn't realize how her actions were affecting you.

dialog.text: I think you're right. I'll give her a call and see what's up. The seeker  feels upset because he was worried about his friend and now knows it isn't true. The supporter could offer him support to change his relationship with the girlfriend.

dialog.text: I think you're right. I'm going to give her a chance to make things right. The seeker  feels upset because his friend has a new girlfriend and he is not connected with her as before.
